item.title: Apache warns of critical flaws in MINA, HugeGraph, Traffic Control
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Apache Software Foundation has released security updates to address three severe problems that affect MINA, HugeGraph-Server, and Traffic Control products. [...]

item.title: New 'OtterCookie' malware used to backdoor devs in fake job offers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: North Korean threat actors are using new malware called OtterCookie in the Contagious Interview campaign that is targeting software developers. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 installation media bug causes security update failures
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft is warning of an issue when using a media support to install Windows 11, version 24H2, that causes the operating system to not accept further security updates. [...]

item.title: Five lesser known Task Manager features in Windows 11
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Windows 11 is far from perfect, but it does make Task Manager significantly better. In this article, we're going to take a closer look at some of our favourite Task Manager features. [...]

item.title: New botnet exploits vulnerabilities in NVRs, TP-Link routers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Mirai-based malware campaign is actively exploiting unpatched vulnerabilities in Internet of Things (IoT) devices, including DigiEver DS-2105 Pro DVRs. [...]

item.title: European Space Agency's official store hacked to steal payment cards
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: European Space Agency's official web shop was hacked as it started to load a piece of JavaScript code that generates a fake Stripe payment page at checkout. [...]

item.title: FBI links North Korean hackers to $308 million crypto heist
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The North Korean hacker group 'TraderTraitor' stole $308 million worth of cryptocurrency in the attack on the Japanese exchange DMM Bitcoin in May. [...]

item.title: Clop ransomware is now extorting 66 Cleo data-theft victims
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Clop ransomware gang started to extort victims of its Cleo data theft attacks and announced on its dark web portal that 66 companies have 48 hours to respond to the demands. [...]
